gurmukhi: bhu ibiD kY jg ko duK dXo ]
transliteration: Bahu Bidh(i) Kai Jag Ko Doukh Dayo||
translation: Who, in many ways, distressed the world;
Then the Lord manifested Himself as Machh (Fish) incarnation,
Who repeated His Own name Himself.39.
At first he Lord manifested Himself as small fish,
Seeing which Shankhasura got greatly enraged.40.

gurmukhi: qbY kop grijXo blI sMK bIrM ] Dry ssqR AsqRM sjy loh cIrM ]
transliteration: Tabai Kop Gadjiyo Balisankh Bderan|| Ddare Sastra Astran Saje Loh Chderan||
translation: Then in great anger, the mighty Shankhasura thundered and wore his armour bedecking himself with weapons and arms;

gurmukhi: cqur byd pwqM kIXo isMD m`DM ] qRsXo AstnYxM kirXo jwpu su`DM ]41]
transliteration: Chatur Bed Paatan Keeyo Sindh Maddhan|| Trasyo Astnainan Kariyo Jaap(u) Suddhan||41||
translation: He threw the fore Vedas in the ocean, which frightened the eitht-eyed Brahma and caused him to remember the Lord.41.

gurmukhi: qbY sMBry dIn hyqM idAwlM ] Dry loh kRohM kiRpw kY kiRpwlM ]
transliteration: Tabai Sanbhare Deen Hetan Diaalan|| Ddare Loh Krohan Kridaa Kai Kridaalan||
translation: Then the Lord, the well-wisher of both (the Vedas as well as Brahma) ws filled with kindness and highly enraged, He wore His steel-armour.

gurmukhi: mhw AsqR pwqM kry ssqR GwqM ] try dyv srbM igry lok swqM ]42]
transliteration: Mahaa Astra Paatan Dare Sastra Ghaatan|| Dare Dev Saraban Gire Lok Saatan||42||
translation: The bows of weapons were struck alongwith arms causing destruction. All the gods in groups moved away from their seats and the seven worlds trembled because of this horrible war.42.
